definition: to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor

sentences.english: At what point does a noble deed turn into fanaticism ?
sentences.chinese: 告訴我，是怎麼從做一樁善舉，走上不歸路的？

sentences.english: Debts of $100，000 had driven them to the murder-suicide.
sentences.chinese: 因欠債十萬元，走上自殺和謀殺不歸路。

sentences.english: But, don’t click on that link! You’re traveling down a slippery slope, friend.
sentences.chinese: 但是別點那個東西，你將走上一條不歸路，朋友。

sentences.english: The distance relative returning journey is distant.
Spring and live, see splendor in the grass said, no way back.
sentences.chinese: 春且住，見說道，天涯芳草無歸路。

sentences.english: And such a way of thinking is a cliff of “cocksure”.
sentences.chinese: 而這種想法是一條‘自以爲是’的不歸路。

sentences.english: At what point does a noble deed turn into fanaticism?
sentences.chinese: 告訴我，是怎麼從做一樁善舉，走上不歸路的？

sentences.english: Tell me something. At what point does a noble deed turn into fanaticism?
sentences.chinese: 告訴我，是怎麼從做一樁善舉，走上不歸路的？

sentences.english: He joked that he had went to a no-return road.
sentences.chinese: 他開玩笑說是走上了不歸路。
